{
    "number": 69819,
    "data": "30,60,90,120,150,180,240,270,300,360,450,480,540,600,720,750,810,858,900,960,1080,1200,1350,1440,1500,1620,1716,1722,1800,1920,2160,2250,2400,2430,2574,2700,2880,3000,3240,3432,3444,3600,3750,3840,4050,4320",
    "name": "Numbers n such that 1/(sum(p|n,1/p)-1), where p are the prime divisors of n, is an integer.",
    "comment": [
        "Sequence is generated by A007850(n). For example: 30,858,1722 (30=2*3*5, 858=2*3*11*13, 1722=2*3*11*13) generate numbers of the form 2^a*3^b*5^c, 2^a*3^b*7^c*41^d, 2^a*3^b*11^c*13^d, (a,b,c,d => 1), which are in the sequence."
    ],
    "example": [
        "E.g. if n=30=2*3*5 1/(sum(p|n,1/p)-1)=1/(1/2+1/3+1/5-1)=30 hence 30 is in the sequence."
    ],
    "keyword": "easy,nonn",
    "offset": "1,1",
    "author": "_Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 28 2002",
    "references": 2,
    "revision": 6,
    "time": "2012-03-30T18:38:57-04:00",
    "created": "2003-05-16T03:00:00-04:00"
}
